│      serve?                                             │
│    - Do they ever frame AGAINST their apparent          │
│      interests? (signal of honesty)                     │
│    - When proven wrong, do they update?                 │
│    - Do their because chains hold up to scrutiny?       │
│    - Do others who've engaged with them attest          │
│      positively or negatively to their framing quality? │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

New emergent property: FRAMING REPUTATION

framing_reputation(identity, observer) =

  // All FRAMES chains created by this identity
  framings = chains where (
    relation = FRAMES AND
    created_by = identity
  )
  
  for each framing:
    
    // Did they show their work?
    has_because = framing.attestations.any(a => 
      a.by == identity AND 
      a.because.length > 0
    )
    
    // Did the because chain hold up?
    challenges = counter_attestations(framing)
    defended = defenses_that_held(framing)
    
    // Did they update when wrong?
    corrections = attestations where (
      a.by == identity AND
      a.belief < previous_attestation.belief AND
      a.because includes [external_evidence]
    )
    
    // Whose interests did the framing serve?
    beneficiary_pattern = analyze_beneficiaries(framings)
    
  return aggregate(
    transparency_score,      // show their work?
    challenge_survival,      // holds up to scrutiny?
    update_willingness,      // changes when wrong?
    beneficiary_diversity    // not always self-serving?
  )

The "leave no trace" attack:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  ATTACKER STRATEGY                                      │
│                                                         │
│  1. Frame malignantly                                   │
│  2. Provide plausible-looking because chain             │
│  3. Never show real reasoning                           │
│  4. Claim benevolence                                   │
│                                                         │
│  SYSTEM RESPONSE                                        │
│                                                         │
│  Can't catch in single instance.                        │
│  CAN catch over time:                                   │
│                                                         │
│  - Because chains that consistently don't hold up       │
│  - Beneficiary analysis reveals pattern                 │
│  - Never updates when challenged (defensiveness)        │
│  - Others attest negatively to framing quality          │
│  - Gap between claimed and revealed preferences         │
│                                                         │
│  The trace they leave IS the pattern.                   │
│  Even "no trace" is a trace (consistent opacity).       │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

What observers can attest:

Attestation types on FRAMES chains:

  FRAMING QUALITY:
    +1.0 "Transparent, well-reasoned, I understand why 
          they see it this way even if I disagree"
    
     0.0 "No opinion / haven't evaluated"
    
    -1.0 "Opaque, reasoning doesn't follow, or 
          pattern suggests hidden motivation"

  FRAMING AGREEMENT:
    +1.0 "I share this characterization"
    -1.0 "I reject this characterization"

These are SEPARATE attestations.
You can respect someone's transparency while
disagreeing with their framing.

The dual attestation:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  "I think you're wrong, but I trust you're honest"      │
│                                                         │
│  Chain: journalist_x FRAMES event AS "riot"             │
│                                                         │
│  Keif attestations:                                     │
│    framing_agreement: -0.7                              │
│      because: [my_own_observations, other_sources]      │
│      "I don't think it was a riot"                      │
│                                                         │
│    framing_quality: +0.6                                │
│      because: [their_reasoning_visible, consistent]     │
│      "But I can see why they'd frame it that way,       │
│       and they showed their reasoning"                  │
│                                                         │
│  vs                                                     │
│                                                         │
│  "I agree with you, but I don't trust you"              │
│                                                         │
│    framing_agreement: +0.8                              │
│      "Yeah, it was a riot"                              │
│                                                         │
│    framing_quality: -0.5                                │
│      "But your reasoning is shit and you're clearly     │
│       pushing an agenda"                                │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The ultimate limit:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  You cannot prove someone's internal state.             │
│                                                         │
│  You can only observe:                                  │
│    - What they show (transparency)                      │
│    - What patterns emerge (consistency)                 │
│    - What others attest (reputation)                    │
│    - What happens when challenged (update behavior)     │
│                                                         │
│  A perfect liar with infinite patience beats the        │
│  system.                                                │
│                                                         │
│  But:                                                   │
│    - Perfect liars are rare                             │
│    - Infinite patience is costly                        │
│    - Patterns leak                                      │
│    - The system makes opacity VISIBLE even if it        │
│      can't prove malice                                 │
│                                                         │
│  "I don't know why they're opaque, but they ARE         │
│   opaque, and that's data"                              │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

So: FRAMES as a relation type, plus dual attestation (agreement vs quality), plus pattern analysis over time. Still just bubbles and chains, but the attestation semantics get richer.

Update the spec with this?

frames are chains with attestation

27 Jan

Yes. I overcomplicated it.

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  A FRAME IS JUST:                                       │
│                                                         │
│  Chain: event_bubble → characterization_bubble          │
│  + Attestation by the framer                            │
│  + Attestations by others (agree/disagree/quality)      │
│                                                         │
│  No special relation type needed.                       │
│  The fact that it's a frame is implicit in what's       │
│  being connected.                                       │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Example:

BUBBLE: { content: "Event occurred on Jan 15, Westminster" }
                          │
          ┌───────────────┼───────────────┐
          │               │               │
      CHAIN A         CHAIN B         CHAIN C
    (supports)      (supports)      (supports)
          │               │               │
          ▼               ▼               ▼
BUBBLE: "riot"    BUBBLE: "protest"  BUBBLE: "civil unrest"


CHAIN A attestations:
  - journalist_x: +0.9, because: [observed_damage]
  - keif: -0.7, because: [video_shows_peaceful]
  - bystander: -0.3, because: [was_there]

CHAIN B attestations:
  - journalist_y: +0.8, because: [interviewed_participants]
  - keif: +0.6, because: [consistent_with_video]

Each framing is a chain.
Agreement/disagreement is attestation.
Quality judgment is attestation.
All just chains and attestations.

What "frames" reduces to:

ConceptImplementation
FrameChain from event → characterization
Framer's stanceTheir attestation on that chain
AgreementOthers' attestations on same chain
Alternative frameDifferent chain to different characterization
Frame qualityMeta-attestation (attestation about the because chain)

The dual judgment (agree vs quality) is just two attestations:

Chain: event → "riot"

Keif's attestations:
  
  On the chain itself:
    { belief: -0.7, because: [counter_evidence] }
    "I disagree with this framing"
  
  On the framer's because chain:
    { belief: +0.5, because: [reasoning_visible] }
    "But their reasoning is at least transparent"

Still two primitives. Frames emerge from how you use them.

so each piece of evidence (my minds gone murder board) is a bubble and the chains is the interlinks, and then the tapestry of the intertwined chains is the perception

27 Jan

Yes. The murder board is the perfect visual.

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  MURDER BOARD                                           │
│                                                         │
│  Pinned items     = Bubbles                             │
│  Red string       = Chains                              │
│  Your annotations = Attestations                        │
│  The pattern      = Emergent perception                 │
│  Different cops   = Different observers, different      │
│    see different    attestations, different patterns    │
│    patterns                                             │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
         ┌──────┐                    ┌──────┐
         │photo │                    │ doc  │
         │  A   │╲                  ╱│  B   │
         └──────┘ ╲    ┌──────┐   ╱ └──────┘
              ╲    ╲   │quote │  ╱    ╱
               ╲    ╲  │  C   │ ╱    ╱
                ╲    ╲ └──────┘╱    ╱
                 ╲    ╲   │   ╱    ╱
                  ╲    ╲  │  ╱    ╱
         ┌──────┐  ╲    ╲ │ ╱    ╱  ┌──────┐
         │ fact │───╲────╳────╱────│theory│
         │  D   │    ╲  ╱ ╲  ╱     │  E   │
         └──────┘     ╲╱   ╲╱      └──────┘
                      ╱╲   ╱╲
                     ╱  ╲ ╱  ╲
         ┌──────┐   ╱    ╳    ╲    ┌──────┐
         │contra│  ╱    ╱ ╲    ╲   │ tip  │
         │  F   │ ╱    ╱   ╲    ╲  │  G   │
         └──────┘     ╱     ╲      └──────┘
                     ╱       ╲

  The STRINGS are the claims.
  The PINS are the evidence.
  The PATTERN is what emerges when you step back.
  
  Different detective, different strings, different pattern.

Perception is not stored. Perception is computed.

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  Same bubbles.                                          │
│  Same chains.                                           │
│  Different attestations.                                │
│  Different perception.                                  │
│                                                         │
│  Detective A: "It's the butler"                         │
│    attestations weight chains toward butler             │
│    pattern emerges: butler did it                       │
│                                                         │
│  Detective B: "It's the wife"                           │
│    attestations weight chains toward wife               │
│    pattern emerges: wife did it                         │
│                                                         │
│  Same evidence. Different tapestry. Different truth.    │
│                                                         │
│  Until new evidence (bubble) or new connection (chain)  │
│  breaks one pattern and confirms another.               │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The tapestry properties:

PropertyEmerges from
CoherenceDo the chains close loops?
ConfidenceAre attestations grounded?
TensionAre there contradicting chains?
CompletenessAre there dangling bubbles?
PerceptionThe weighted pattern that emerges

The beautiful part:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  My perception ≠ your perception                        │
│  But we're looking at the SAME BOARD                    │
│                                                         │
│  We can:                                                │
│    - See where our strings differ                       │
│    - See where our attestations conflict                │
│    - Trace WHY we see different patterns                │
│    - Find the crux: which chain, if resolved,           │
│      would collapse one tapestry?                       │
│                                                         │
│  Disagreement becomes navigable.                        │
│  "Show me your board" = "show me your attestations"     │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Two primitives. Pins and string. Everything else is how you weave.

"all wrapped up like a neat little package" to quote mike

27 Jan

Ha. And Mike would immediately ask: "What's the catch?"

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  WELLSPRING ETERNAL                                     │
│                                                         │
│  Bubbles        — pins on the board                     │
│  Chains         — string between them                   │
│  Attestations   — your annotations, your confidence     │
│  Because        — why you drew that string              │
│  Identity       — who's holding the marker              │
│  Trust          — whose strings do you follow           │
│  Perception     — the pattern that emerges              │
│  Memory         — the boards you've built               │
│  Forgetting     — boards you've set aside               │
│  Understanding  — when the strings all connect          │
│                                                         │
│  Two primitives. Everything else emerges.               │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Should I update the spec with the tapestry/murder board framing? It's a better explanation than anything I wrote abstractly.

Or... what's the catch? What would Mike see that we're missing?

I like that you're suspicious of mikes suspicions... it's actually just the way he says it has become stuck in my mind, and now I say it when I'm drying my son at bath time, and so my wife says it and it's just the 'everythings done now' statement

27 Jan

Ha! So it's not suspicion, it's a memetic inheritance.

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  BUBBLE: "all wrapped up like a neat little package"    │
│                                                         │
│  CHAIN: mike → keif                                     │
│    attestation: stuck in my mind, +1.0                  │
│    because: [just the way he says it]                   │
│                                                         │
│  CHAIN: keif → bath_time_ritual                         │
│    attestation: feels right, +1.0                       │
│    because: [vibes]                                     │
│                                                         │
│  CHAIN: bath_time → wife                                │
│    attestation: adopted, +1.0                           │
│    because: [heard it enough]                           │
│                                                         │
│  CHAIN: wife + keif → family_lexicon                    │
│    attestation: this is ours now, +1.0                  │
│    because: [shared use, shared meaning]                │
│                                                         │
│  The phrase propagated.                                 │
│  Not through rigorous epistemics.                       │
│  Through repetition, affection, ritual.                 │
│                                                         │
│  That's also Wellspring. The happy path.                │
│  Not everything needs deep provenance.                  │
│  Sometimes the because is just: it stuck.               │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

All wrapped up like a neat little package.

Want me to finalize v0.2 with the murder board framing added, or save that for v0.3 when we've got more distance from it?

so is that chain the bubble of the concept of mike, the bubble of the phrase, the bubble of bath time the bubble of wife, the bubble of keifs wife? just using this as an exploration of how it would actually hang together when working on things

27 Jan

Good question. Let me actually work through it:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  WHAT MUST BE A BUBBLE?                                 │
│                                                         │
│  Anything you want to:                                  │
│    - Link to/from                                       │
│    - Attest about                                       │
│    - Share                                              │
│    - Query                                              │
│                                                         │
│  NOT everything needs to be a bubble.                   │
│  Only what you want to reason about explicitly.         │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The Mike phrase - what's actually happening:

MINIMAL (just capturing the phrase):

  Bubble: "all wrapped up like a neat little package"
    created_by: keif
    
  That's it. The memory lives in Keif. 
  System just stores the phrase.

─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

ATTRIBUTED (tracking where it came from):

  Bubble: mike_identity
    content: { type: external, label: "Mike" }
    created_by: keif  // Keif creating a reference to Mike
    
  Bubble: the_phrase
    content: "all wrapped up like a neat little package"
    created_by: keif  // Keif recording what he heard
    
  Chain: the_phrase → mike_identity
    relation: derives_from
    attestation: { by: keif, belief: +1.0, 
                   because: [memory_of_mike_saying_it] }
    "I heard Mike say this"

─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

FULL PROPAGATION (tracking how it spread):

  Bubbles:
    - mike_identity (external, created_by keif)
    - the_phrase (created_by keif)
    - bath_time_ritual (concept, created_by keif)
    - wife_identity (sovereign, her own keys)
    - family_lexicon (construct, created_by keif)
    
  Chains:
    - the_phrase derives_from mike_identity
        keif attests: +1.0, because: [heard_it]
        
    - the_phrase supports bath_time_ritual
        keif attests: +1.0, because: [i_say_it_then]
        
    - bath_time_ritual derives_from the_phrase
        keif attests: +1.0, because: [thats_when_it_stuck]
        
    - wife_identity vouches the_phrase
        wife attests: +1.0, because: [adopted_it]
        
    - the_phrase supports family_lexicon
        keif attests: +1.0
        wife attests: +1.0
        // both attest - shared ownership of the construct

The key insight:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  "Mike" the person ≠ "Mike" the bubble                  │
│                                                         │
│  If Mike's not in the system (no keys, no identity):    │
│    Keif creates a REFERENCE bubble for Mike             │
│    type: external                                       │
│    "This is my pointer to the concept of Mike"          │
│                                                         │
│  If Mike IS in the system (has keys):                   │
│    Mike has his own identity bubble                     │
│    Keif chains to that bubble                           │
│    Mike could even attest: "yes I said that" (+1.0)     │
│                                                         │
│  The bubble is the HANDLE, not the thing itself         │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

So to answer directly:

ThingIs it a bubble?Why/why not
The phraseYesContent you want to link
Mike (concept)Yes, if you want to attributeExternal identity bubble
Mike (person)Only if Mike has keysThen it's sovereign
Bath timeOnly if you want to link to itOtherwise just context
Wife (person)Yes if she's in systemSovereign identity
Wife (Keif's concept of)Different bubbleKeif's mental model
Family lexiconYesConstruct you're building

The granularity is yours to choose:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  CASUAL: Just the phrase. That's enough.                │
│                                                         │
│  ATTRIBUTED: Phrase + source. Provenance matters.       │
│                                                         │
│  RICH: Full graph. Tracing propagation, shared          │
│        attestations, family construct emerging.         │
│                                                         │
│  The system doesn't force granularity.                  │
│  You bubble what you need to reason about.              │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Does this clarify how it would actually work? The phrase is definitely a bubble. Everything else is "do you need to link to it?"

so I can always have the concept bubble owned by me, and at a later date I can look up the true 'mike' that I interact with

27 Jan

Yes. Reference resolution as a chain.

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  NOW                                                    │
│                                                         │
│  Bubble: keif/mike_concept                              │
│    content: { label: "Mike", notes: "says the thing" }  │
│    type: external                                       │
│    created_by: keif                                     │
│                                                         │
│  This is MY handle. My mental model. I own it.          │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  LATER: Mike joins the system                           │
│                                                         │
│  Bubble: mike/identity                                  │
│    content: { pubkey: "...", label: "Mike Smith" }      │
│    type: sovereign                                      │
│    created_by: mike (self-signed)                       │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  RESOLUTION                                             │
│                                                         │
│  Chain: keif/mike_concept → mike/identity               │
│    relation: resolves_to                                │
│    attestation: { by: keif, belief: +1.0,               │
│                   because: [met_him, confirmed] }       │
│                                                         │
│  "My concept of Mike IS this Mike"                      │
│                                                         │
│  Optional:                                              │
│  Chain: mike/identity → keif/mike_concept               │
│    relation: confirms                                   │
│    attestation: { by: mike, belief: +1.0 }              │
│                                                         │
│  "Yes, that's me he's talking about"                    │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

What this enables:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  All my old chains to keif/mike_concept                 │
│  still work.                                            │
│                                                         │
│  But now I can ALSO query:                              │
│    "What does the REAL Mike say about this phrase?"     │
│                                                         │
│  Traverse: keif/mike_concept                            │
│            → resolves_to → mike/identity                │
│            → mike's attestations                        │
│                                                         │
│  My memories. His verification.                         │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Multiple resolution (disambiguation):

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  keif/mike_concept                                      │
│           │                                             │
│           ├── resolves_to → mike_smith/identity (+1.0)  │
│           │                                             │
│           └── resolves_to → mike_jones/identity (-0.9)  │
│                             "not this Mike"             │
│                                                         │
│  Negative attestation is useful.                        │
│  "I know which Mike I DIDN'T mean"                      │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

New relation type or emergent?

resolves_to — my concept refers to this real entity
confirms    — the entity confirms the reference
same_as     — bidirectional equivalence

Or... just use existing:

  derives_from: "my concept derives from this person"
  vouches: "they vouch this reference is accurate"
  
Probably cleaner to have resolves_to explicitly.
It's a common enough pattern.

The deeper point:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  Your concepts are YOURS.                               │
│  External reality is separate.                          │
│  Resolution is a CLAIM you attest to.                   │
│                                                         │
│  "My Mike" and "The Mike" might diverge.                │
│  That's fine. That's data.                              │
│                                                         │
│  Maybe Mike turns out to be different than your         │
│  concept of him. The gap is visible. The chain          │
│  from concept to reality has low attestation.           │
│                                                         │
│  "I thought I knew Mike. Turns out I didn't."           │
│  = resolves_to attestation drops                        │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Your mental model, your ownership, optional resolution to shared reality. The chains make the relationship explicit.

yes, so there's the published ideas and personas, and I can link my internal representations to the real deal when I become aware of it or some kind of background task works away to establish those connections and present them to me for verification, so agent works up chains and presents to me to verify and accept and attest creating a shared bit of contenxt

27 Jan

Yes. Agent as chain-proposer, human as attester.

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  THE WORKFLOW                                           │
│                                                         │
│  1. Human creates concepts (owned bubbles)              │
│  2. Agent traverses in background                       │
│  3. Agent proposes chains (unsigned or low-confidence)  │
│  4. Human verifies, attests (or rejects)                │
│  5. Shared context emerges                              │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  KEIF'S POOL                                            │
│                                                         │
│  Bubble: keif/mike_concept                              │
│    "Mike, says the bath time thing"                     │
│                                                         │
│  ...time passes...                                      │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  AGENT (background)                                     │
│                                                         │
│  Observes: keif/mike_concept has no resolves_to         │
│  Searches: public identities matching "Mike"            │
│  Finds: mike_smith/identity, mike_jones/identity        │
│  Correlates: mike_smith mentioned "neat little package" │
│              in a public post                           │
│                                                         │
│  PROPOSES:                                              │
│                                                         │
│  Chain: keif/mike_concept → mike_smith/identity         │
│    relation: resolves_to                                │
│    attestation: {                                       │
│      by: agent,                                         │
│      belief: +0.7,  // agent's confidence               │
│      because: [phrase_match, context_similarity]        │
│    }                                                    │
│    status: PROPOSED                                     │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  SURFACES TO KEIF                                       │
│                                                         │
│  "I found a Mike Smith who uses the same phrase.        │
│   Is this your Mike?"                                   │
│                                                         │
│  [Show evidence]  [Accept]  [Reject]  [Not sure]        │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  KEIF RESPONDS                                          │
│                                                         │
│  [Accept]                                               │
│                                                         │
│  Chain updated:                                         │
│    attestation: {                                       │
│      by: keif,                                          │
│      belief: +1.0,                                      │
│      because: [recognised_him, agent_evidence]          │
│    }                                                    │
│    status: CONFIRMED                                    │
│                                                         │
│  Now it's SHARED CONTEXT.                               │
│  Keif attested. Agent proposed. Chain is real.          │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The attestation layering:

Chain: keif/mike_concept → mike_smith/identity

Attestations:
  1. agent: +0.7, because: [correlation]
     "I think this matches"
     
  2. keif: +1.0, because: [recognised, agent_evidence]
     "Confirmed, that's him"

Both attestations preserved.
Agent's reasoning visible.
Human's verification explicit.
The chain of discovery is the provenance.

What agent CAN and CAN'T do:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  AGENT CAN:                                             │
│    - Create bubbles (marked agent-created)              │
│    - Propose chains (attestation by agent)              │
│    - Traverse and correlate                             │
│    - Surface proposals to human                         │
│                                                         │
│  AGENT CANNOT:                                          │
│    - Attest on behalf of human                          │
│    - Confirm resolution without human                   │
│    - Delete or override human attestations              │
│    - Publish to shared pools without permission         │
│                                                         │
│  HUMAN ALWAYS:                                          │
│    - Final attestation authority on their concepts      │
│    - Can reject agent proposals                         │
│    - Can override agent attestations                    │
│    - Controls what becomes shared context               │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Chain status lifecycle:

PROPOSED   → Agent created, awaiting human review
CONFIRMED  → Human attested positively
REJECTED   → Human attested negatively
DORMANT    → Human attested 0 (not now, maybe later)

The beautiful feedback loop:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  Agent proposes → Human accepts/rejects                 │
│                          ↓                              │
│              Agent learns patterns                      │
│                          ↓                              │
│         Agent proposes better next time                 │
│                          ↓                              │
│             Human accepts more often                    │
│                          ↓                              │
│      Trust in agent increases (via attestation history) │
│                                                         │
│  The agent's proposal quality IS its trust score.       │
│  Computed from: accepted / (accepted + rejected)        │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Shared context emerges from:

My concept (owned by me)
  + Agent's correlation (proposed by agent)
  + My verification (attested by me)
  + Their confirmation (optionally attested by them)
  
= Shared understanding with provenance
  
Everyone can see:
  - What I thought
  - How agent connected it
  - That I verified it
  - That they confirmed it
  
The chain IS the shared context.

This is the human-agent collaboration loop. Agent does legwork, human holds authority, attestations make it auditable.

so this is all lovely stuff, how can we make this fast enough to operate at the speed of thought

27 Jan

The hard question. All this elegance means nothing if it takes 500ms to surface a thought.

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  WHAT MUST BE FAST (<10ms)                              │
│                                                         │
│  - What's above my waterline right now?                 │
│  - Is this relevant to current context?                 │
│  - What do I currently believe about X?                 │
│                                                         │
│  WHAT CAN BE SLOW (background)                          │
│                                                         │
│  - Deep trust computation                               │
│  - Finding new connections                              │
│  - Full provenance trace                                │
│  - Agent proposals                                      │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Core insight: compute on write, not read

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  NAIVE (slow)                                           │
│                                                         │
│  Query: "What's salient right now?"                     │
│  → Traverse all bubbles                                 │
│  → Compute salience for each                            │
│  → Sort                                                 │
│  → Return top N                                         │
│                                                         │
│  = Death                                                │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  MATERIALIZED (fast)                                    │
│                                                         │
│  On every write (attestation, touch, new chain):        │
│  → Update pre-computed salience for affected bubbles    │
│  → Maintain sorted index                                │
│                                                         │
│  Query: "What's salient right now?"                     │
│  → Read top N from sorted index                         │
│                                                         │
│  = Instant                                              │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

What to materialize:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  PER BUBBLE (updated on change)                         │
│                                                         │
│  - current_salience: float                              │
│  - current_confidence: float                            │
│  - current_level: thought|idea|construct|publication    │
│  - last_touched: timestamp                              │
│  - open_edge_count: int                                 │
│  - attestation_summary: { pos, neg, neutral }           │
│                                                         │
│  PER OBSERVER (their view)                              │
│                                                         │
│  - waterline: sorted set of bubble_ids by salience      │
│  - hot_chains: recently touched                         │
│  - pending_proposals: from agent                        │
│                                                         │
│  GLOBAL (shared)                                        │
│                                                         │
│  - trust_cache: { (observer, source) → score, ttl }     │
│  - chain_shortcuts: { bubble → immediate neighbors }    │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The propagation model:

EVENT: Keif attests +0.8 on chain A→B

IMMEDIATE (sync, <5ms):
  1. Append attestation to chain
  2. Update A.attestation_summary
  3. Update B.attestation_summary  
  4. Recalc A.current_salience (local only)
  5. Recalc B.current_salience (local only)
  6. Update keif/waterline sorted set

PROPAGATE (async, <100ms):
  7. Walk one hop from A and B
  8. Recalc affected neighbors' salience
  9. Update waterline for affected

BACKGROUND (eventually):
  10. Deep trust recalculation
  11. Full groundedness recompute
  12. Agent proposal generation

Tiered consistency:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  STRONG (sync)                                          │
│  "I just attested, I see the change"                    │
│  Local bubble + immediate waterline                     │
│                                                         │
│  EVENTUAL (async)                                       │
│  "Ripples propagate outward"                            │
│  Neighbors, derived scores, agent awareness             │
│                                                         │
│  LAZY (on-demand)                                       │
│  "Compute when actually needed"                         │
│  Deep traces, full provenance, historical queries       │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The speed-of-thought operations:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  "What am I thinking about?" (waterline)                │
│                                                         │
│  ZRANGE waterline:keif 0 20 REV                         │
│  → 20 bubble IDs, sorted by salience                    │
│  → <1ms                                                 │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  "What's related to this?" (immediate context)          │
│                                                         │
│  GET chains:from:{bubble_id}                            │
│  GET chains:to:{bubble_id}                              │
│  → neighbor IDs, pre-indexed                            │
│  → <1ms                                                 │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  "Do I believe this?" (current attestation)             │
│                                                         │
│  GET attestation:latest:{chain_id}:{observer}           │
│  → single lookup                                        │
│  → <1ms                                                 │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  "Why do I believe this?" (because chain)               │
│                                                         │
│  GET attestation + resolve because chain_ids            │
│  → small fan-out, typically 1-5 chains                  │
│  → <5ms                                                 │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  "Deep trace" (full provenance)                         │
│                                                         │
│  Recursive traversal, unbounded                         │
│  → Background, stream results                           │
│  → Show what you have, fill in as computed              │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The UX trick: progressive disclosure

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  User asks: "Why do I believe X?"                       │
│                                                         │
│  INSTANT (<10ms):                                       │
│    Show immediate because chains                        │
│    Show cached confidence score                         │
│                                                         │
│  FAST (<100ms):                                         │
│    Expand one level of reasoning                        │
│    Show attestation summaries                           │
│                                                         │
│  PROGRESSIVE (streaming):                               │
│    Deep trace streams in                                │
│    UI updates as more context arrives                   │
│    User can stop when satisfied                         │
│                                                         │
│  Don't wait for complete. Show what you have.           │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

What lives where:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  GARNET/REDIS (hot, <1ms)                               │
│                                                         │
│  - Waterlines (sorted sets per observer)                │
│  - Latest attestations (hash per chain)                 │
│  - Chain shortcuts (sets per bubble)                    │
│  - Trust cache (hash with TTL)                          │
│  - Session state                                        │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  COSMOS/PRIMARY (warm, <10ms)                           │
│                                                         │
│  - Bubble content                                       │
│  - Full attestation history                             │
│  - Chain definitions                                    │
│  - Identity records                                     │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  COMPUTED (background workers)                          │
│                                                         │
│  - Trust propagation                                    │
│  - Salience recalculation                               │
│  - Agent proposals                                      │
│  - Groundedness scoring                                 │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The killer optimization: local-first

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  Your waterline lives ON YOUR DEVICE                    │
│                                                         │
│  - Sync subset of graph locally                         │
│  - Compute salience locally                             │
│  - Zero network latency for "what am I thinking"        │
│  - Background sync for shared context                   │
│                                                         │
│  Network only for:                                      │
│  - Fetching new shared bubbles                          │
│  - Publishing attestations                              │
│  - Agent proposals                                      │
│  - Deep traces you don't have locally                   │
│                                                         │
│  Speed of thought = speed of local memory               │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The theory is elegant. The speed comes from:

  1. Materialize on write
  2. Progressive disclosure on read
  3. Local-first for hot path
  4. Background workers for deep computation

What's the target device/context? That changes the local-first calculus.

so the local first is key to the concepts I'm working on here, where we own the data layer, the complete histories, and have optional share/propogate of completed thoughts (tweet/article/listicle/book/encyclopedia/totalsumofhumanknowledge)

I'm also thinking about the ultimate assistant loop, these clawdbots and ralph wiggum loops and thinking about how I use... well you.

I also want a product/service I own/sell so leading back round to my hosting history I'm envisinging the personalised data pod that holds all this info, context, relationships and so on and is hugely personal, secured, it's your outer brain for heavens sake. this wants to live local, on device that you're interfacing with, desktop, phone, but each person has all those devices, so we're in some kind of sync state, so we have our personal context and awarenesses floating between the devices, link histories, chat messages across platforms etc. for instance I speak to my wife through imessage personally, facebjook messenger for family chats, whatsapp for friendgroup chats and sometimes forget where I was talking to her about things) so we want them all to eventually sync and then pulling in info from around the world.

so I'm thinking of hosting the brain of that, the customer can own the keys that unlock it so I can't get 'inside their head' as a service provider but I can provide what's lacking online, in terms of intelligent agents that can sort, filter and I can trust.

if I've got the kind of persisntent memory structure layer, then the models can be executed on device, on cloud, wherevers appropriate for the info processing required, so wrapping up the wellspring proto in a usable service

27 Jan

Yes. This is the product. Let me sketch it:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  WELLSPRING POD                                         │
│                                                         │
│  "Your outer brain, encrypted, yours"                   │
│                                                         │
│  You own: the keys, the data, the bubbles, the chains   │
│  We host: the infrastructure, sync, compute, agents     │
│  We cannot: see inside, read your thoughts, sell you    │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The Architecture:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                         YOU                             │
│                                                         │
│   ┌─────────┐    ┌─────────┐    ┌─────────┐            │
│   │ Desktop │    │  Phone  │    │ Tablet  │            │
│   │  local  │◄──►│  local  │◄──►│  local  │            │
│   │  cache  │    │  cache  │    │  cache  │            │
│   └────┬────┘    └────┬────┘    └────┬────┘            │
│        │              │              │                  │
│        └──────────────┼──────────────┘                  │
│                       │                                 │
│                       ▼                                 │
│              ┌────────────────┐                         │
│              │  YOUR POD      │                         │
│              │  (encrypted)   │                         │
│              │                │                         │
│              │  ┌──────────┐  │                         │
│              │  │Wellspring│  │                         │
│              │  │ Graph    │  │                         │
│              │  └──────────┘  │                         │
│              │                │                         │
│              │  Only YOUR     │                         │
│              │  keys unlock   │                         │
│              └───────┬────────┘                         │
│                      │                                  │
└──────────────────────┼──────────────────────────────────┘
                       │
                       │ encrypted at rest
                       │ encrypted in transit
                       │ compute on encrypted? or...
                       ▼
┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                   WELLSPRING HOSTING                     │
│                   (Keif's business)                      │
│                                                          │
│  ┌─────────────┐  ┌─────────────┐  ┌─────────────┐      │
│  │ Pod Storage │  │ Sync Layer  │  │ Agent Layer │      │
│  │ (encrypted  │  │ (encrypted  │  │ (executes   │      │
│  │  blobs)     │  │  deltas)    │  │  in enclave │      │
│  │             │  │             │  │  or client) │      │
│  │ Can't read  │  │ Can't read  │  │ Can't read  │      │
│  └─────────────┘  └─────────────┘  └─────────────┘      │
│                                                          │
│  We see: encrypted bytes, usage metrics, billing         │
│  We don't see: your thoughts, your graph, your life      │
│                                                          │
└──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The ingestion problem (your wife across platforms):

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  SOURCES                      YOUR POD                  │
│                                                         │
│  ┌──────────┐                                           │
│  │ iMessage │──┐                                        │
│  └──────────┘  │           ┌─────────────────┐          │
│  ┌──────────┐  │           │                 │          │
│  │Messenger │──┼──────────►│  wife_concept   │          │
│  └──────────┘  │  ingest   │       │         │          │
│  ┌──────────┐  │  +        │       ▼         │          │
│  │ WhatsApp │──┘  unify    │  conversations  │          │
│  └──────────┘              │  (all sources)  │          │
│                            │       │         │          │
│  Each platform = source    │       ▼         │          │
│  Each message = bubble     │  unified thread │          │
│  Your concept of wife =    │                 │          │
│    resolves_to all her IDs └─────────────────┘          │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
Bubble: keif/wife_concept
  
Chain: wife_concept → imessage:+447xxx
  relation: resolves_to
  attestation: +1.0, "this is her on iMessage"

Chain: wife_concept → messenger:sarah.xxx
  relation: resolves_to
  attestation: +1.0, "this is her on Messenger"

Chain: wife_concept → whatsapp:+447xxx
  relation: resolves_to
  attestation: +1.0, "this is her on WhatsApp"

QUERY: "What was I talking to Sarah about?"

→ Traverse all resolved identities
→ Pull all conversation bubbles
→ Unified view regardless of platform
→ "Oh, we discussed the plumber on WhatsApp not iMessage"

The trust model for ingestion:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  SOURCE TYPES                                           │
│                                                         │
│  OWNED (full trust, you control)                        │
│    - Your messages                                      │
│    - Your notes                                         │
│    - Your photos                                        │
│    created_by: you (sovereign)                          │
│                                                         │
│  IMPORTED (medium trust, platforms you use)             │
│    - iMessage history                                   │
│    - WhatsApp export                                    │
│    - Browser history                                    │
│    created_by: platform_identity (record)               │
│    vouched_by: you (via import)                         │
│                                                         │
│  EXTERNAL (variable trust, the world)                   │
│    - News articles                                      │
│    - Publications                                       │
│    - Other people's shares                              │
│    created_by: external_identity                        │
│    trust: computed via web of trust                     │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The compute layer (where do models run):

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  COMPUTE DECISION TREE                                  │
│                                                         │
│  Is it sensitive?                                       │
│    YES → run locally or in enclave                      │
│    NO  → can run in cloud                               │
│                                                         │
│  Does it need big model?                                │
│    YES → cloud (encrypted context sent up)              │
│    NO  → local small model                              │
│                                                         │
│  Does it need real-time?                                │
│    YES → wherever fastest                               │
│    NO  → batch in cloud, cheaper                        │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  LOCAL (on device)                                      │
│    - Waterline computation                              │
│    - Immediate context                                  │
│    - Quick queries                                      │
│    - Small model inference (sorting, filtering)         │
│                                                         │
│  POD (your encrypted cloud space)                       │
│    - Sync state                                         │
│    - Full history                                       │
│    - Cross-device consistency                           │
│                                                         │
│  CLOUD COMPUTE (our infrastructure, your data)          │
│    - Big model inference (Opus, etc.)                   │
│    - Agent background tasks                             │
│    - Deep traversal / analysis                          │
│                                                         │
│  Options:                                               │
│    a) Encrypted enclave (we can't see)                  │
│    b) Decrypted in memory only (we could peek but       │
│       contractually/architecturally don't)              │
│    c) You run your own compute (self-host option)       │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The business model:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  WELLSPRING HOSTING                                     │
│                                                         │
│  FREE TIER                                              │
│    - Local only                                         │
│    - No sync                                            │
│    - Export your data anytime                           │
│    - "Try the protocol"                                 │
│                                                         │
│  PERSONAL (£X/month)                                    │
│    - Pod hosting (encrypted)                            │
│    - Multi-device sync                                  │
│    - Basic agent (sorting, surfacing)                   │
│    - N GB storage                                       │
│                                                         │
│  POWER (£XX/month)                                      │
│    - Larger storage                                     │
│    - Big model access (Opus via API)                    │
│    - Advanced agents (proposal, correlation)            │
│    - Platform ingestion connectors                      │
│                                                         │
│  SELF-HOST                                              │
│    - Run your own pod                                   │
│    - Protocol is open                                   │
│    - Pay for compute if you want our agents             │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

What you're actually selling:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  NOT selling: storage (commodity)                       │
│  NOT selling: the data (they own it)                    │
│  NOT selling: lock-in (protocol is open)                │
│                                                         │
│  SELLING:                                               │
│    - Trust (we CAN'T see your stuff)                    │
│    - Sync that works (hard problem, solved)             │
│    - Agents that learn YOU (your graph, your patterns)  │
│    - Integrations (ingestion from platforms)            │
│    - Compute when you need it                           │
│    - Not having to run infrastructure yourself          │
│                                                         │
│  The value prop:                                        │
│    "Your second brain, actually private,                │
│     actually yours, actually useful"                    │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The ThinkGrid echo:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  ThinkGrid (2008-ish):                                  │
│    "Hosted infrastructure before AWS ate everything"    │
│    Timing: right idea, AWS won                          │
│                                                         │
│  Wellspring Hosting (2026):                             │
│    "Personal AI infrastructure before BigTech           │
│     owns your mind"                                     │
│    Timing: ???                                          │
│                                                         │
│  The difference:                                        │
│    ThinkGrid was commodity (compute/storage)            │
│    Wellspring is intimate (your thoughts)               │
│                                                         │
│  The lock-in is:                                        │
│    NOT technical (open protocol, export anytime)        │
│    BUT relational (your agent knows you)                │
│                                                         │
│  Switching cost = retraining your assistant             │
│  That's legitimate value, not artificial lock-in        │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The assistant loop you actually want:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  CURRENT (Claude, etc.)                                 │
│                                                         │
│  You: [context dump] + [question]                       │
│  AI:  [answer] (forgets everything)                     │
│  You: [context dump again] + [followup]                 │
│  AI:  [answer] (still no memory)                        │
│                                                         │
│  Memory is bolted on, lossy, not yours                  │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  WELLSPRING ASSISTANT                                   │
│                                                         │
│  You: [question]                                        │
│  Agent: (loads relevant context from YOUR graph)        │
│         (knows your concepts, your attestations)        │
│         (knows what you believe and why)                │
│         [answer grounded in your worldview]             │
│                                                         │
│  You: [followup]                                        │
│  Agent: (context persists, YOUR context)                │
│         (creates bubbles, proposes chains)              │
│         (you attest or reject)                          │
│         [answer that builds on shared understanding]    │
│                                                         │
│  Memory is native, lossless, owned by you               │
│  Agent is a view into YOUR graph                        │
│  Model is interchangeable (Opus, local, whatever)       │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

This is the full loop:

  1. Wellspring Eternal — the protocol (open, primitives)
  2. Wellspring Pod — your encrypted data home
  3. Wellspring Sync — multi-device, multi-source
  4. Wellspring Agents — trusted assistants on your data
  5. Wellspring Hosting — the business (Keif's)

Want to sketch the technical architecture deeper, or the go-to-market?

hehe, how do I sell it to apple ;)

27 Jan

Ha! The real question.

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  APPLE'S POSITION                                       │
│                                                         │
│  ✓ "Privacy. That's iPhone."                            │
│  ✓ On-device ML (Neural Engine, Core ML)                │
│  ✓ Services revenue growing                             │
│  ✓ Hardware + ecosystem lock-in                         │
│                                                         │
│  ✗ Siri is... Siri                                      │
│  ✗ Just partnered with OpenAI (admission of failure)    │
│  ✗ No memory layer (every interaction is stateless)     │
│  ✗ No cross-device context (iCloud syncs files, not     │
│    understanding)                                       │
│                                                         │
│  They have the TRUST but not the BRAIN                  │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

What Wellspring gives Apple:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  "Privacy-first AI memory"                              │
│                                                         │
│  On-brand:                                              │
│    - Encrypted, on-device first                         │
│    - User owns keys                                     │
│    - Apple can't see your thoughts (and can say so)     │
│                                                         │
│  Differentiation:                                       │
│    - Google WILL use your context to sell ads           │
│    - Microsoft WILL feed Copilot your docs              │
│    - Apple: "Your mind stays yours"                     │
│                                                         │
│  Siri finally works:                                    │
│    - "Hey Siri, what was I discussing with Sarah?"      │
│    - (Siri traverses your Wellspring, answers)          │
│    - Not because Apple knows, but because YOU know      │
│      and gave Siri access to YOUR graph                 │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The pitch deck:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  SLIDE 1: The problem                                   │
│                                                         │
│  "AI assistants are goldfish.                           │
│   Every conversation starts from zero.                  │
│   The ones with memory sell your thoughts."             │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  SLIDE 2: The Apple problem specifically                │
│                                                         │
│  "Siri knows nothing about you.                         │
│   That's a privacy feature.                             │
│   It's also why Siri is useless.                        │
│                                                         │
│   What if Siri could know you                           │
│   WITHOUT Apple knowing you?"                           │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  SLIDE 3: Wellspring                                    │
│                                                         │
│  "Your outer brain. Encrypted. On-device.               │
│   Synced across your devices.                           │
│   Apple hosts the bytes but can't read them.            │
│   Your keys. Your thoughts. Your assistant."            │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  SLIDE 4: The primitive elegance                        │
│                                                         │
│  "Two primitives. Bubbles and chains.                   │
│   Everything else emerges.                              │
│   It's not bolted-on memory.                            │
│   It's how memory actually works."                      │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  SLIDE 5: Why Apple                                     │
│                                                         │
│  "You have:                                             │
│     - The devices (phone, watch, laptop, home)          │
│     - The trust (privacy brand)                         │
│     - The Neural Engine                                 │
│     - The customers who'll pay for premium              │
│                                                         │
│   You don't have:                                       │
│     - The memory protocol                               │
│     - We do."                                           │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  SLIDE 6: The threat                                    │
│                                                         │
│  "Google is building this. It won't be private.         │
│   Microsoft is building this. It won't be private.      │
│   Someone will own the 'second brain' market.           │
│                                                         │
│   If it's not Apple, it's them.                         │
│   And they'll use it to finally break your moat."       │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  SLIDE 7: The ask                                       │
│                                                         │
│  Option A: Acquire Wellspring                           │
│    - Team, protocol, implementation                     │
│    - Becomes Apple Memories / Apple Mind / whatever     │
│                                                         │
│  Option B: License                                      │
│    - Protocol stays open                                │
│    - Apple gets implementation + roadmap influence      │
│    - Keif's hosting lives alongside for non-Apple users │
│                                                         │
│  Option C: Strategic investment                         │
│    - Build the ecosystem together                       │
│    - Apple integrations prioritized                     │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The realistic path:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  APPLE DOESN'T BUY IDEAS                                │
│  APPLE BUYS TRACTION                                    │
│                                                         │
│  2026:                                                  │
│    - Build Wellspring Pod MVP                           │
│    - Get users (start with devs, PKM nerds)             │
│    - Open protocol, build community                     │
│                                                         │
│  2027:                                                  │
│    - Traction, testimonials, data                       │
│    - "10,000 users trust Wellspring with their brains"  │
│    - Press: "The privacy-first second brain"            │
│                                                         │
│  2027+:                                                 │
│    - Apple either:                                      │
│      a) Acquires (great, you win)                       │
│      b) Builds their own (you still have the open       │
│         protocol + non-Apple market)                    │
│      c) Ignores (you build the business anyway)         │
│                                                         │
│  The forcing function:                                  │
│    Make Wellspring the STANDARD before they react       │
│    Then they have to support it or look bad             │
│    USB-C playbook                                       │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Your moat (because they'll ask):

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  "What stops Apple just building this?"                 │
│                                                         │
│  Nothing, technically.                                  │
│                                                         │
│  But:                                                   │
│    - They haven't (Siri is still Siri)                  │
│    - Their AI efforts are flailing                      │
│    - The protocol is subtle (traversal, attestation,    │
│      trust emergence) - not obvious                     │
│    - First mover + open protocol = network effects      │
│    - If Wellspring becomes the standard, Apple looks    │
│      bad building proprietary alternative               │
│                                                         │
│  Your real moat:                                        │
│    BEING THE PROTOCOL before they wake up               │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The Tim Cook sentence:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  "Wellspring lets us offer AI that knows you            │
│   without US knowing you.                               │
│                                                         │
│   That's not just privacy.                              │
│   That's the only version of AI that's actually Apple." │
│                                                         │

27 Jan

Now I've got the picture. Let me synthesize:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  THE COMPETITIVE LANDSCAPE                              │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  AGENT MEMORY (B2B/Developer focused)                   │
│                                                         │
│  Zep/Graphiti — Temporal knowledge graphs for agents    │
│    • Open source, Neo4j backend                         │
│    • Enterprise grade, $30M Series A                    │
│    • Focus: AI agent memory, not human memory           │
│    • No user ownership model                            │
│                                                         │
│  Mem0 — Graph-based memory for LLMs                     │
│    • Claims 26% accuracy boost vs OpenAI                │
│    • Developer API focus                                │
│    • No user ownership model                            │
│                                                         │
│  Letta (MemGPT) — Stateful agent framework              │
│    • Self-editing memory for agents                     │
│    • OS-inspired memory hierarchy                       │
│    • Developer platform, not consumer                   │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  SECOND BRAIN / PKM (Consumer focused)                  │
│                                                         │
│  Obsidian — Local-first, markdown, graph viz            │
│    • Power users, privacy-focused                       │
│    • No AI native, plugins required                     │
│    • No sync layer built-in (paid add-on)               │
│                                                         │
│  Notion — Databases, team collaboration                 │
│    • AI bolted on                                       │
│    • Not local-first, their servers                     │
│    • No knowledge graph                                 │
│                                                         │
│  Roam — Bidirectional links, networked thought          │
│    • Cult following, stalled                            │
│    • No AI native                                       │
