│  → Find all chains where:                               │
│      - transmitted_via → sync_channel_keif_claude       │
│      - has attestation by claude with belief > 0        │
│                                                         │
│  "What's pending?"                                      │
│                                                         │
│  → Find all chains where:                               │
│      - transmitted_via → sync_channel_keif_claude       │
│      - has attestation by keif                          │
│      - NO attestation by claude                         │
│                                                         │
│  "What did Claude dispute?"                             │
│                                                         │
│  → Find all chains where:                               │
│      - transmitted_via → sync_channel_keif_claude       │
│      - has attestation by claude with belief < 0        │
│      - Check because for reason                         │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Trail membership is also chains:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  TRAIL: trail:7f83b162...                               │
│                                                         │
│  CHAIN: keif → member_of → trail                        │
│    attestation: { by: keif, +1.0, because: [genesis] }  │
│    attestation: { by: claude, +1.0, because: [invited] }│
│                                                         │
│  CHAIN: claude → member_of → trail                      │
│    attestation: { by: claude, +1.0 }                    │
│    attestation: { by: keif, +1.0, because: [i_invited] }│
│                                                         │
│  CHAIN: sarah → member_of → trail                       │
│    attestation: { by: sarah, +1.0 }                     │
│    attestation: { by: keif, +1.0 }                      │
│    attestation: { by: claude, +0.5 }  ← less sure       │
│                                                         │
│  Membership IS mutual attestation.                      │
│  Permissions emerge from who attested what.             │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Even the transport is attestable:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  CHAIN: message_xyz → sent_via → websocket_conn_123     │
│    attestation: { by: keif_pod, +1.0, at: T1 }          │
│                                                         │
│  CHAIN: message_xyz → received_via → websocket_conn_123 │
│    attestation: { by: claude_pod, +1.0, at: T2 }        │
│                                                         │
│  Latency = T2 - T1                                      │
│  Receipt proof = claude's attestation                   │
│  Audit trail = traversable                              │
│                                                         │
│  Want to prove delivery? Show the attestation.          │
│  Want to prove non-delivery? Absence of attestation.    │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The elegance:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  ONE PRIMITIVE HANDLES:                                 │
│                                                         │
│  • Content ("this bubble exists")                       │
│  • Relationships ("this links to that")                 │
│  • Belief ("I think this is true")                      │
│  • Sync ("I received this")                             │
│  • Membership ("I'm part of this trail")                │
│  • Permissions ("I attest you can...")                  │
│  • Disputes ("I disagree because...")                   │
│  • History ("at T1, I believed..., at T2, I changed")   │
│                                                         │
│  All chains with attestations.                          │
│  All queryable the same way.                            │
│  All auditable the same way.                            │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

SNAP's insight, expressed in Wellspring:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  SNAP: "Not designed to prevent cheating,               │
│         only confusion about what was sent"             │
│                                                         │
│  WELLSPRING: Mutual attestation proves transmission.    │
│              Disagreement about TRUTH is separate.      │
│              Both are in the graph.                     │
│              Both are queryable.                        │
│                                                         │
│  "Did Claude receive my message?"                       │
│    → Check for Claude's attestation on transmission     │
│                                                         │
│  "Does Claude agree with my claim?"                     │
│    → Check Claude's attestation on the claim itself     │
│                                                         │
│  Different questions. Same primitive. Same query.       │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

This collapses the stack. Protocol IS data. Sync IS attestation. The graph describes itself.

so, leads back to partner discovery. I have these thoughts, I want to share these thoughts, I need people to be able to find my thoughts

27 Jan

Right. The hardest part. You can have the most elegant sync protocol, but if nobody knows you exist...

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  THE DISCOVERY PROBLEM                                  │
│                                                         │
│  Private:  Keif ←→ Claude  (bilateral, solved)          │
│                                                         │
│  Public:   Keif → ??? → Someone who cares               │
│                                                         │
│  How does "someone who cares" find Keif's thoughts?     │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The options:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  1. CENTRALIZED DIRECTORY                               │
│     "Register your pod with wellspring.io"              │
│     + Simple, works                                     │
│     - Single point of failure/control                   │
│     - Defeats the purpose                               │
│                                                         │
│  2. DHT (BitTorrent-style)                              │
│     "Announce to distributed hash table"                │
│     + No central server                                 │
│     - Topic discovery is hard                           │
│     - Need to know what you're looking for              │
│                                                         │
│  3. GOSSIP (ScuttleButt-style)                          │
│     "Tell friends, they tell friends"                   │
│     + Organic, trust-based spread                       │
│     - Slow, limited reach                               │
│     - Echo chambers                                     │
│                                                         │
│  4. FEDERATION (ActivityPub/Mastodon)                   │
│     "Servers talk to servers"                           │
│     + Proven at scale                                   │
│     - Still need to pick a server                       │
│     - Server admins have power                          │
│                                                         │
│  5. ATPROTO (Bluesky)                                   │
│     "Relays aggregate, you choose your view"            │
│     + Account portability                               │
│     + Algorithmic choice                                │
│     - Relays are centralizing                           │
│                                                         │
│  6. SOLID                                               │
│     "Pods + WebID + LDP"                                │
│     + Standards-based                                   │
│     - Discovery still unsolved                          │
│     - Nobody uses it                                    │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

But wait — discovery is ALSO chains with attestations:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  PUBLICATION AS ATTESTATION                             │
│                                                         │
│  Keif has a thought. Wants it discoverable.             │
│                                                         │
│  CHAIN: thought → published_to → pool:uk-construction   │
│    attestation: { by: keif, +1.0,                       │
│                   because: [relevant_to_topic] }        │
│                                                         │
│  The POOL is the discovery surface.                     │
│  Publishing = attesting "this belongs here"             │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Pools as discovery surfaces:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  POOL: pool:uk-construction-tech                        │
│                                                         │
│  Properties:                                            │
│    - Has an identity (discoverable)                     │
│    - Has members (who can publish)                      │
│    - Has a topic (what it's about)                      │
│    - Has a trust policy (who's credible)                │
│    - Has a location (where to find it)                  │
│                                                         │
│  The pool IS a bubble. With chains to:                  │
│    - Members (membership attestations)                  │
│    - Published content (publication chains)             │
│    - Other pools (federation/bridging)                  │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The registry problem:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  HOW DO YOU FIND THE POOL?                              │
│                                                         │
│  Option A: Pool has a well-known location               │
│    pool:uk-construction-tech → https://ukct.pool.ws     │
│    DNS-based, but pool controls its data                │
│                                                         │
│  Option B: Pool is content-addressed                    │
│    pool:sha256:abc123... → find via DHT                 │
│    Fully decentralized, but need to know the hash       │
│                                                         │
│  Option C: Pool is registered in directories            │
│    Search "construction UK" → directories return pools  │
│    Multiple competing directories (no single point)     │
│                                                         │
│  Option D: Pool is announced by members                 │
│    "I'm in pool X" → follow the web of trust            │
│    Organic discovery through people you trust           │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The ATProto insight:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  ATProto separates:                                     │
│    - Identity (DID, portable)                           │
│    - Data (PDS, your server)                            │
│    - Discovery (Relay, aggregator)                      │
│    - Curation (AppView, algorithm)                      │
│                                                         │
│  You own identity + data.                               │
│  Relays compete to aggregate.                           │
│  AppViews compete to curate.                            │
│                                                         │
│  WELLSPRING EQUIVALENT:                                 │
│                                                         │
│    - Identity: did:wellspring:keif (yours)              │
│    - Data: Your pod (yours)                             │
│    - Discovery: Pools (multiple, competing)             │
│    - Curation: Trust policies (you choose)              │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Pools as relay-equivalents:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  POOL OPERATOR                                          │
│                                                         │
│  Runs:                                                  │
│    - Aggregation service (collects published content)   │
│    - Index (searchable by topic, author, time)          │
│    - Feed (what's new in this pool)                     │
│    - Membership (who's in, vouched by whom)             │
│                                                         │
│  Doesn't control:                                       │
│    - Your data (stays in your pod)                      │
│    - Your identity (your keys)                          │
│    - Your relationships (your attestations)             │
│                                                         │
│  If pool goes bad:                                      │
│    - You're still in other pools                        │
│    - Your data still exists                             │
│    - You can join/create competing pool                 │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The publication flow:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  1. Keif creates thought (bubble in his pod)            │
│                                                         │
│  2. Keif decides to publish to pool:uk-construction     │
│                                                         │
│  3. Creates chain:                                      │
│     thought → published_to → pool:uk-construction       │
│     attestation: { by: keif, +1.0 }                     │
│                                                         │
│  4. Notifies pool (push or pool pulls)                  │
│                                                         │
│  5. Pool validates:                                     │
│     - Is keif a member? (check membership chain)        │
│     - Does content meet pool rules?                     │
│     - Spam check, etc.                                  │
│                                                         │
│  6. Pool attests:                                       │
│     attestation: { by: pool:uk-construction, +1.0,      │
│                    because: [member, valid] }           │
│                                                         │
│  7. Pool adds to index, appears in feeds                │
│                                                         │
│  8. Sarah, browsing pool, discovers Keif's thought      │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Multiple pools, one thought:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  BUBBLE: keif/thought/cosmos-partitioning               │
│                                                         │
│  CHAIN: thought → published_to → pool:uk-construction   │
│  CHAIN: thought → published_to → pool:azure-developers  │
│  CHAIN: thought → published_to → pool:database-nerds    │
│                                                         │
│  Same thought, multiple discovery surfaces.             │
│  Each pool has its own attestation.                     │
│  Reach scales with relevance.                           │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Finding pools (the bootstrap):

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  WELL-KNOWN REGISTRIES                                  │
│                                                         │
│  pools.wellspring.io/search?topic=construction          │
│    → Returns list of pools, with metadata               │
│    → You choose which to join                           │
│    → Registry is just another service, replaceable      │
│                                                         │
│  SOCIAL DISCOVERY                                       │
│                                                         │
│  "What pools is Sarah in?"                              │
│    → Look at her membership chains                      │
│    → She's vouched for these pools                      │
│    → Trust propagates                                   │
│                                                         │
│  CROSS-POOL LINKS                                       │
│                                                         │
│  Pool A links to Pool B:                                │
│    CHAIN: pool:A → related_to → pool:B                  │
│    → Discover adjacent communities                      │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The web of trust for pools:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  Pool discovery through trust chains:                   │
│                                                         │
│  keif trusts sarah (vouch chain)                        │
│  sarah is member of pool:proptech                       │
│  sarah attests pool:proptech is good (+0.9)             │
│                                                         │
│  keif's computed trust in pool:proptech:                │
│    trust(keif, sarah) × sarah's_attestation             │
│    = 0.8 × 0.9 = 0.72                                   │
│                                                         │
│  "Pools trusted by people you trust"                    │
│  Organic, no central authority.                         │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Summary:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  DISCOVERY = PUBLICATION + POOLS + TRUST                │
│                                                         │
│  Publication:  Chain your thought to a pool             │
│  Pool:         Aggregates, indexes, serves feeds        │
│  Trust:        Pools discovered via web of trust        │
│                                                         │
│  All expressible as bubbles, chains, attestations.      │
│  No new primitives needed.                              │
│                                                         │
│  Centralization risk:                                   │
│    Pools CAN become powerful (like Mastodon instances)  │
│    Mitigation: easy to create pools, easy to leave      │
│    Your data stays in YOUR pod regardless               │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The pool is the public square. But you own your house, and you choose which squares to speak in.

Want to dig into pool governance, or pool-to-pool federation?

so a pool is the grouping of ideas/activities and makes sense so we actually have personal pools and pool discovery, public/private and sync perms (read/write/admin). pool federation makes sense

27 Jan

Yes. Pools all the way down.

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  POOL HIERARCHY                                         │
│                                                         │
│  keif/pool:private          ← Your brain, default       │
│  keif/pool:family           ← Shared with spouse, kids  │
│  keif/pool:buymaterials     ← Work context              │
│  pool:uk-construction       ← Public, topic-based       │
│  pool:wellspring-dev        ← Public, project-based     │
│                                                         │
│  Everything lives in a pool.                            │
│  Your "pod" IS your personal pool.                      │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Pool as primitive:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  BUBBLE: pool:xyz                                       │
│    type: pool                                           │
│    name: "UK Construction Tech"                         │
│    visibility: public | private | unlisted              │
│    created_by: did:wellspring:keif                      │
│    created_at: 2026-01-27                               │
│                                                         │
│  CHAINS:                                                │
│                                                         │
│  keif → member_of → pool:xyz                            │
│    attestation: { by: keif, +1.0 }                      │
│    attestation: { by: pool:xyz, +1.0 }  ← accepted      │
│                                                         │
│  keif → has_role → pool:xyz                             │
│    role: admin | write | read                           │
│    attestation: { by: pool:xyz, +1.0 }                  │
│                                                         │
│  thought_abc → published_to → pool:xyz                  │
│    attestation: { by: keif, +1.0 }                      │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Permissions as attestations:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  PERMISSION MODEL                                       │
│                                                         │
│  READ:   Can sync pool content to your pod              │
│  WRITE:  Can publish to pool (create chains into it)    │
│  ADMIN:  Can grant/revoke permissions                   │
│                                                         │
│  Expressed as:                                          │
│                                                         │
│  CHAIN: sarah → can_read → pool:xyz                     │
│    attestation: { by: pool:xyz (admin), +1.0 }          │
│                                                         │
│  CHAIN: sarah → can_write → pool:xyz                    │
│    attestation: { by: pool:xyz (admin), +1.0 }          │
│                                                         │
│  CHAIN: sarah → can_admin → pool:xyz                    │
│    attestation: { by: pool:xyz (admin), +1.0 }          │
│                                                         │
│  Revoke = attest -1.0 or 0.0 on permission chain        │
│                                                         │
│  CHAIN: sarah → can_write → pool:xyz                    │
│    attestation: { by: admin, +1.0, at: T1 }  ← granted  │
│    attestation: { by: admin, 0.0, at: T2 }   ← revoked  │
│                                                         │
│  Permission at time T = latest attestation before T     │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Pool visibility:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  PUBLIC                                                 │
│    - Pool appears in registries                         │
│    - Anyone can request read access                     │
│    - Content discoverable via search                    │
│                                                         │
│  UNLISTED                                               │
│    - Pool exists, not in registries                     │
│    - Need link/invitation to find                       │
│    - "Secret but shareable"                             │
│                                                         │
│  PRIVATE                                                │
│    - Not advertised anywhere                            │
│    - Invitation only                                    │
│    - "Your brain" / "Family only"                       │
│                                                         │
│  Visibility = metadata on pool bubble                   │
│  Enforcement = sync protocol checks permissions         │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Personal pool = your pod:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  keif/pool:private                                      │
│                                                         │
│  - Created automatically with identity                  │
│  - You are sole admin                                   │
│  - Default home for all your bubbles                    │
│  - Sync only with your own devices                      │
│                                                         │
│  Your "waterline" = view into your private pool         │
│                                                         │
│  Publishing = creating chain from private → other pool  │
│                                                         │
│  CHAIN: thought → published_to → pool:uk-construction   │
│                                                         │
│  Original stays in your pool.                           │
│  Chain makes it visible elsewhere.                      │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Pool federation:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  POOL RELATIONSHIPS                                     │
│                                                         │
│  CHAIN: pool:uk-construction → federated_with →         │
│         pool:eu-construction                            │
│    attestation: { by: pool:uk (admin), +1.0 }           │
│    attestation: { by: pool:eu (admin), +1.0 }           │
│                                                         │
│  Federation = mutual attestation                        │
│  Both pools agree to share content                      │
│                                                         │
│  FEDERATION MODES:                                      │
│                                                         │
│  Mirror:    All content synced both ways                │
│  Bridge:    Selected content crosses over               │
│  Subscribe: One-way, pool A reads pool B                │
│                                                         │
│  CHAIN: pool:A → subscribes_to → pool:B                 │
│    attestation: { by: pool:A, +1.0 }                    │
│    attestation: { by: pool:B, +1.0 }  ← B permits       │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Cross-pool publishing:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  Keif posts in pool:uk-construction                     │
│  Pool:uk-construction federated with pool:eu-constr     │
│                                                         │
│  Content flow:                                          │
│                                                         │
│  keif/pool:private                                      │
│       │                                                 │
│       │ published_to                                    │
│       ▼                                                 │
│  pool:uk-construction                                   │
│       │                                                 │
│       │ federated_with (mirror)                         │
│       ▼                                                 │
│  pool:eu-construction                                   │
│                                                         │
│  Sarah in EU pool sees Keif's content.                  │
│  Chain of custody is visible.                           │
│  Trust computed through federation path.                │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Pool discovery (revised):

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  DISCOVERY POOLS                                        │
│                                                         │
│  pool:wellspring-directory                              │
│    - Meta-pool: contains references to other pools      │
│    - Anyone can publish "my pool exists"                │
│    - Searchable by topic, region, etc.                  │
│                                                         │
│  CHAIN: pool:uk-construction → listed_in →              │
│         pool:wellspring-directory                       │
│    attestation: { by: pool:uk-construction, +1.0 }      │
│    metadata: { topic: "construction",                   │
│                region: "uk",                            │
│                members: 150 }                           │
│                                                         │
│  Multiple directories can exist.                        │
│  Compete on curation quality.                           │
│  No single point of control.                            │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The full picture:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│                  DIRECTORY POOLS                        │
│            ┌─────────────────────────┐                  │
│            │ pool:wellspring-dir     │                  │
│            │ pool:indie-pools        │                  │
│            │ pool:eu-directories     │                  │
│            └───────────┬─────────────┘                  │
│                        │ listed_in                      │
│         ┌──────────────┼──────────────┐                 │
│         ▼              ▼              ▼                 │
│  ┌────────────┐ ┌────────────┐ ┌────────────┐          │
│  │ pool:uk-   │ │ pool:eu-   │ │ pool:azure │          │
│  │ construct  │◄─► construct  │ │ -devs     │          │
│  └─────┬──────┘ └────────────┘ └─────┬──────┘          │
│        │ federated_with              │                  │
│        │                             │                  │
│  ┌─────┴──────────────────────┬──────┴─────┐           │
│  │                            │            │           │
│  ▼                            ▼            ▼           │
│ keif/pool:private    sarah/pool:private   ...          │
│ (your pod)           (her pod)                         │
│                                                         │
│  published_to chains connect personal → public         │
│  federated_with chains connect public ↔ public         │
│  listed_in chains connect public → directory           │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Sync protocol with permissions:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  REQUEST_SYNC                                           │
│  {                                                      │
│    from: "did:wellspring:sarah",                        │
│    pool: "pool:uk-construction",                        │
│    since: "2026-01-27T00:00:00Z"                        │
│  }                                                      │
│                                                         │
│  POOL CHECKS:                                           │
│                                                         │
│  1. Is sarah a member? (membership chain)               │
│  2. Does sarah have read permission? (can_read chain)   │
│  3. Is permission currently valid? (latest attestation) │
│                                                         │
│  IF YES:                                                │
│    → Send ops since timestamp                           │
│    → Establish sync channel                             │
│                                                         │
│  IF NO:                                                 │
│    → Reject with reason                                 │
│    → Or: return public-only subset if public pool       │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Invitation flow:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  Keif invites Sarah to pool:family                      │
│                                                         │
│  1. Keif creates:                                       │
│     CHAIN: sarah → invited_to → pool:family             │
│       attestation: { by: keif (admin), +1.0 }           │
│       permissions: [read, write]                        │
│       expires: 2026-02-27 (optional)                    │
│                                                         │
│  2. Keif sends Sarah:                                   │
│     wellspring://pool:family?invite=<signed_token>      │
│                                                         │
│  3. Sarah's pod:                                        │
│     - Resolves pool                                     │
│     - Validates invitation                              │
│     - Creates: sarah → member_of → pool:family          │
│       attestation: { by: sarah, +1.0 }                  │
│                                                         │
│  4. Pool (or Keif as admin) attests membership:         │
│     CHAIN: sarah → member_of → pool:family              │
│       attestation: { by: pool:family, +1.0 }            │
│                                                         │
│  5. Sync begins.                                        │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

What we've got:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  PRIMITIVES: Bubble, Chain, Attestation                 │
│                                                         │
│  EXPRESSED AS POOLS:                                    │
│    - Personal (your pod)                                │
│    - Shared (family, team)                              │
│    - Public (topic communities)                         │
│    - Meta (directories)                                 │
│                                                         │
│  PERMISSIONS: Chains with attestations                  │
│    - read / write / admin                               │
│    - Granted, revoked, time-bounded                     │
│                                                         │
│  FEDERATION: Mutual attestation between pools           │
│    - Mirror, bridge, subscribe                          │
│                                                         │
│  DISCOVERY: Pools listing in directory pools            │
│    - Multiple competing directories                     │
│    - Trust-based recommendation                         │
│                                                         │
│  SYNC: SNAP-style bilateral, permission-checked         │
│                                                         │
│  Still just bubbles, chains, attestations.              │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Want to capture this in the spec, or push further into trail mechanics within/across pools?

I'm considering how this actually implements the wot group concensus system I was thinking about a few years ago

27 Jan

Yes. WOT is a Wellspring application. The primitives ARE the consensus engine.

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  WOT = WELLSPRING FOR GROUP DECISIONS                   │
│                                                         │
│  "When shall we meet?"                                  │
│  "Where shall we go?"                                   │
│  "What shall we do?"                                    │
│  "What are we watching?"                                │
│                                                         │
│  Each question = find consensus across attestations     │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Mapping WOT to Wellspring:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  WOT CONCEPT          WELLSPRING PRIMITIVE              │
│                                                         │
│  Group/Gang           Pool (shared, private)            │
│  Participant          Member of pool                    │
│  Option               Bubble (restaurant, time, movie)  │
│  Preference           Attestation (+1.0 love, -1.0 hate)│
│  Constraint           Attestation with because          │
│  Calendar block       Bubble + attestation (can't: -1.0)│
│  Proposal             Chain (option → proposed_for →    │
│                              decision)                  │
│  Consensus            Computed from attestations        │
│  Decision             Bubble with winning attestations  │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

A WOT decision as graph:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  POOL: keif/pool:friday-gang                            │
│    members: keif, sarah, mike, jules                    │
│                                                         │
│  BUBBLE: decision:friday-dinner                         │
│    type: decision                                       │
│    question: "Where for dinner Friday?"                 │
│    deadline: 2026-01-31T18:00:00Z                       │
│                                                         │
│  OPTIONS (bubbles):                                     │
│    option:nandos                                        │
│    option:wagamama                                      │
│    option:the-local-pub                                 │
│                                                         │
│  CHAINS:                                                │
│    option:nandos → proposed_for → decision:friday       │
│    option:wagamama → proposed_for → decision:friday     │
│    option:the-local-pub → proposed_for → decision:friday│
│                                                         │
│  ATTESTATIONS (the votes):                              │
│                                                         │
│    option:nandos:                                       │
│      keif: +0.8, because: [kids_like_it]                │
│      sarah: +0.5                                        │
│      mike: -0.3, because: [had_it_tuesday]              │
│      jules: +0.7                                        │
│                                                         │
│    option:wagamama:                                     │
│      keif: +0.6                                         │
│      sarah: +0.9, because: [craving_ramen]              │
│      mike: +0.8                                         │
│      jules: 0.0   ← hasn't voted yet                    │
│                                                         │
│    option:the-local-pub:                                │
│      keif: +0.4                                         │
│      sarah: -1.0, because: [no_veggie_options]          │
│      mike: +0.9                                         │
│      jules: +0.5                                        │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Consensus computation:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  SIMPLE: Average attestation per option                 │
│                                                         │
│    nandos:     (0.8 + 0.5 - 0.3 + 0.7) / 4 = 0.425     │
│    wagamama:   (0.6 + 0.9 + 0.8 + 0) / 4 = 0.575       │
│    local-pub:  (0.4 - 1.0 + 0.9 + 0.5) / 4 = 0.2       │
│                                                         │
│  Winner: Wagamama                                       │
│                                                         │
│  BUT: jules hasn't voted on wagamama.                   │
│  WOT pings jules: "Quick vote needed on Wagamama?"      │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  WEIGHTED: By trust or role                             │
│                                                         │
│    Sarah's veto (-1.0) on local-pub kills it            │
│    because: [no_veggie_options] is a hard constraint    │
│                                                         │
│  VETO RULE: Any -1.0 with constraint removes option     │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  SMART: Factor in because chains                        │
│                                                         │
│    mike: -0.3 on nandos because [had_it_tuesday]        │
│    → Temporal constraint, might decay                   │
│    → If decision is for NEXT friday, weight less        │
│                                                         │
│    sarah: +0.9 on wagamama because [craving_ramen]      │
│    → Strong active preference, weight more              │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Calendar as attestations:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  BUBBLE: timeslot:friday-7pm                            │
│  BUBBLE: timeslot:friday-8pm                            │
│  BUBBLE: timeslot:saturday-7pm                          │
│                                                         │
│  CHAINS: timeslot → proposed_for → decision:dinner-when │
│                                                         │
│  ATTESTATIONS:                                          │
│                                                         │
│    friday-7pm:                                          │
│      keif: +1.0                                         │
│      sarah: -1.0, because: [calendar:yoga_class]        │
│      mike: +0.8                                         │
│      jules: +0.5                                        │
│                                                         │
│    friday-8pm:                                          │
│      keif: +0.7, because: [kids_bedtime_tight]          │
│      sarah: +1.0                                        │
│      mike: +0.8                                         │
│      jules: +0.5                                        │
│                                                         │
│    saturday-7pm:                                        │
│      keif: +0.3, because: [prefer_friday]               │
│      sarah: +0.9                                        │
│      mike: -1.0, because: [calendar:away_weekend]       │
│      jules: +1.0                                        │
│                                                         │
│  Calendar imports = auto-generated attestations         │
│  "I can't" = -1.0 with calendar bubble as because       │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Learning preferences over time:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  PREFERENCE BUBBLES (persistent, learned)               │
│                                                         │
│  BUBBLE: sarah/preference:vegetarian                    │
│    attestation: { by: sarah, +1.0,                      │
│                   because: [dietary_requirement] }      │
│                                                         │
│  BUBBLE: mike/preference:no-repeats-within-week         │
│    attestation: { by: mike, +0.8 }                      │
│                                                         │
│  BUBBLE: keif/preference:kid-friendly                   │
│    attestation: { by: keif, +0.9,                       │
│                   because: [has_children] }             │
│                                                         │
│  When new decision created:                             │
│    → WOT agent checks member preferences                │
│    → Auto-filters or auto-attests options               │
│    → "Local pub filtered: Sarah is vegetarian"          │
│                                                         │
│  CHAIN: sarah/preference:vegetarian →                   │
│         conflicts_with → option:the-local-pub           │
│    attestation: { by: wot-agent, +0.9,                  │
│                   because: [no_veggie_menu] }           │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The ping flow:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  DECISION CREATED                                       │
│    ↓                                                    │
│  WOT checks: who hasn't attested?                       │
│    ↓                                                    │
│  Ping jules: "Friday dinner - Nandos, Wagamama, or Pub?"│
│    ↓                                                    │
│  Jules replies: "Wagamama 👍"                           │
│    ↓                                                    │
│  WOT creates attestation: jules → wagamama: +0.8        │
│    ↓                                                    │
│  Consensus reached? Check.                              │
│    ↓                                                    │
│  Yes: "It's Wagamama, Friday 8pm. Everyone in?"         │
│    ↓                                                    │
│  Final confirmation attestations                        │
│    ↓                                                    │
│  DECISION LOCKED                                        │
│    attestation: { by: pool:friday-gang, +1.0,           │
│                   status: confirmed }                   │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

WOT as Wellspring view:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  WELLSPRING = the graph, the primitives, the sync       │
│                                                         │
│  WOT = a UI/UX layer that:                              │
│    - Creates decision bubbles                           │
│    - Proposes options (from memory, from search)        │
│    - Collects attestations (votes)                      │
│    - Computes consensus                                 │
│    - Pings for missing votes                            │
│    - Locks decisions                                    │
│    - Learns preferences                                 │
│                                                         │
│  Same graph. Different lens.                            │
│                                                         │
│  Your "memory system" and your "group planner"          │
│  are the SAME SYSTEM with different queries.            │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The WOT social layer:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  AFTER THE DECISION                                     │
│                                                         │
│  BUBBLE: event:wagamama-friday                          │
│    where: Wagamama Manchester                           │
│    when: 2026-01-31T20:00:00Z                           │
│    who: [keif, sarah, mike, jules]                      │
│                                                         │
│  CHAINS:                                                │
│    event → resulted_from → decision:friday-dinner       │
│    event → at_venue → venue:wagamama-manchester         │
│                                                         │
│  POST-EVENT:                                            │
│                                                         │
│  BUBBLE: memory:wagamama-jan31                          │
│    photos: [...]                                        │
│    attestations:                                        │
│      keif: +0.9, because: [great_ramen]                 │
│      sarah: +0.8                                        │
│      mike: +0.7, because: [service_slow]                │
│      jules: +1.0                                        │
│                                                         │
│  → Feeds back into preferences                          │
│  → Next time: Wagamama has higher base score            │
│  → mike's "service_slow" noted for future               │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Revenue model through the graph:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  DECISION: "Where for dinner Friday?"                   │
│  CONSTRAINTS: vegetarian, kid-friendly, £20pp budget    │
│                                                         │
│  WOT agent searches:                                    │
│    → Your past venues (attestation history)             │
│    → Partner venues (sponsored, but relevant)           │
│    → Public venue pool (reviews, menus)                 │
│                                                         │
│  BUBBLE: option:new-veggie-place (sponsored)            │
│    attestation: { by: venue:new-veggie-place, +1.0,     │
│                   because: [sponsored_placement],       │
│                   offer: "10% off first visit" }        │
│                                                         │
│  Shown because: matches vegetarian + budget + kid       │
│  Marked as: sponsored (transparent)                     │
│  Useful because: actually solves the problem            │
│                                                         │
│  Revenue: Venue pays for qualified placement            │
│           (not eyeballs, but matched intent)            │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The naming:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  WOT = Web of Trust (the protocol underneath)           │
│  WOT = What? Where? When? Who? (the questions it asks)  │
│  WOT = "Wot shall we do?" (British slang, friendly)     │
│                                                         │
│  Wellspring = the memory/knowledge substrate            │
│  WOT = the social decision layer on top                 │
│                                                         │
│  wot.rocks / wot.digital                                │
│    → Consumer-facing group planning app                 │
│    → Built on Wellspring primitives                     │
│    → "Wot shall we do?" "Let me check wot.rocks"        │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The convergence:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  WELLSPRING ETERNAL                                     │
│    Your memory, your knowledge, your trails             │
│    "Where did I learn that?"                            │
│    "Who did I tell?"                                    │
│                                                         │
│            ↓ same primitives ↓                          │
│                                                         │
│  WOT                                                    │
│    Group memory, group preferences, group decisions     │
│    "Where shall we go?"                                 │
│    "What does everyone want?"                           │
│                                                         │
│  Personal memory + shared pools = social cognition      │
│                                                         │
│  The "gang" pool IS a shared Wellspring.                │
│  Decisions are just queries with deadlines.             │
│  Preferences are just persistent attestations.          │
│  Consensus is just aggregated belief.                   │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Strategic implication:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  BUILD WELLSPRING → WOT IS FREE                         │
│                                                         │
│  Wellspring MVP (memory system)                         │
│    → Add decision bubble type                           │
│    → Add consensus computation                          │
│    → Add ping/notification layer                        │
│    → WOT exists                                         │
│                                                         │
│  OR                                                     │
│                                                         │
│  BUILD WOT → WELLSPRING EMERGES                         │
│                                                         │
│  WOT MVP (group decisions)                              │
│    → Preferences = memory                               │
│    → History = trails                                   │
│    → Groups = pools                                     │
│    → Votes = attestations                               │
│    → Wellspring exists                                  │
│                                                         │
│  Same system. Different entry point.                    │
│  Which has faster path to users?                        │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

WOT might actually be the better MVP. Concrete problem ("where for dinner"), immediate value, viral loop (invite your gang), revenue path (venue partnerships).

Wellspring is the infrastructure. WOT is the killer app that proves it.

│ Preference Attestation (+1.0 love, -1.0 hate)│

can we deconstruct this into a nicer primitive. whilst we have analog +1 -1 with float to represent 'love and hate' aren't the only thought, so perhaps an attestation linking bubble also connects to the emotive thought we're attesting, and we can have multiple attestations, keif +1 on nandoes as "enjoys spicy food" +1 "hasn't had enough chips" -0.02 "wants easy life" +0.5

27 Jan

Yes. One number loses the WHY. The attestation should connect through the reason.

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  OLD: Single belief value                               │
│                                                         │
│  keif attests nandos: +0.8                              │
│                                                         │
│  Lost information:                                      │
│    - Why 0.8 and not 0.9?                               │
│    - What aspects matter?                               │
│    - Which reasons pull which direction?                │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  NEW: Attestation per aspect                            │
│                                                         │
│  keif attests nandos:                                   │
│    via "enjoys spicy food"    → +1.0                    │
│    via "hasn't had chips"     → +1.0                    │
│    via "wants easy life"      → -0.02                   │
│    via "kids will eat it"     → +0.8                    │
│    via "parking is awkward"   → -0.3                    │
│                                                         │
│  The "belief" is computed, not stored.                  │
│  The aspects are the data.                              │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Aspect as bubble:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  BUBBLE: keif/aspect:enjoys-spicy                       │
│    type: aspect                                         │
│    domain: food                                         │
│    valence: positive (I seek this)                      │
│                                                         │
│  BUBBLE: keif/aspect:wants-easy-life                    │
│    type: aspect                                         │
│    domain: logistics                                    │
│    valence: positive (I seek this)                      │
│                                                         │
│  BUBBLE: keif/aspect:kids-will-eat                      │
│    type: aspect                                         │
│    domain: family                                       │
│    valence: positive (I seek this)                      │
│                                                         │
│  Aspects are your VALUES, your NEEDS, your MOODS.       │
│  They're bubbles. They persist. They're YOU.            │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Revised attestation structure:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  ATTESTATION (revised)                                  │
│                                                         │
│  {                                                      │
│    by: identity,                                        │
│    on: subject_bubble,                                  │
│    via: aspect_bubble,      ← NEW: what lens/reason     │
│    weight: float,           ← how much this applies     │
│    at: timestamp,                                       │
│    because: [chain_ids],    ← evidence (optional)       │
│    sig: signature                                       │
│  }                                                      │
│                                                         │
│  Multiple attestations per (by, on) pair.               │
│  One per aspect.                                        │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Full example:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  SUBJECT: option:nandos                                 │
│                                                         │
│  KEIF'S ATTESTATIONS:                                   │
│                                                         │
│  { by: keif,                                            │
│    on: nandos,                                          │
│    via: keif/aspect:enjoys-spicy,                       │
│    weight: +1.0 }                                       │
│                                                         │
│  { by: keif,                                            │
│    on: nandos,                                          │
│    via: keif/aspect:chip-craving,                       │
│    weight: +1.0,                                        │
│    because: [keif/meal:tuesday-salad] }  ← been healthy │
│                                                         │
│  { by: keif,                                            │
│    on: nandos,                                          │
│    via: keif/aspect:easy-logistics,                     │
│    weight: -0.02,                                       │
│    because: [nandos/fact:town-center-parking] }         │
│                                                         │
│  { by: keif,                                            │
│    on: nandos,                                          │
│    via: keif/aspect:kids-happy,                         │
│    weight: +0.8,                                        │
│    because: [memory:kids-loved-it-last-time] }          │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Shared vs personal aspects:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  PERSONAL ASPECTS (your values)                         │
│                                                         │
│  keif/aspect:enjoys-spicy                               │
│  keif/aspect:wants-easy-life                            │
│  keif/aspect:budget-conscious                           │
│                                                         │
│  SHARED ASPECTS (pool-level or universal)               │
│                                                         │
│  pool:friday-gang/aspect:everyone-can-eat               │
│  universal/aspect:kid-friendly                          │
│  universal/aspect:vegetarian-options                    │
│                                                         │
│  Sarah attests nandos:                                  │
│    via universal/aspect:vegetarian-options              │
│    weight: +0.6                                         │
│    because: [nandos/menu:halloumi-burger]               │
│                                                         │
│  Now we can query:                                      │
│    "Show me options where everyone attests              │
│     positively on 'everyone-can-eat'"                   │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Computing aggregate belief:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  SIMPLE: Average across aspects                         │
│                                                         │
│  keif on nandos:                                        │
│    spicy:      +1.0                                     │
│    chips:      +1.0                                     │
│    logistics:  -0.02                                    │
│    kids:       +0.8                                     │
│    ─────────────────                                    │
│    average:    +0.695                                   │
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  WEIGHTED: Aspects have importance                      │
│                                                         │
│  keif's aspect weights (persistent):                    │
│    kids-happy:      importance 0.9  (high priority)     │
│    enjoys-spicy:    importance 0.5  (nice to have)      │
│    easy-logistics:  importance 0.7  (matters)           │
│    chip-craving:    importance 0.3  (mood, transient)   │
│                                                         │
│  weighted_belief = Σ(weight × importance) / Σ(importance)│
│                                                         │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                         │
│  CONTEXTUAL: Importance varies by situation             │
│                                                         │
│  "Quick weeknight dinner":                              │
│    easy-logistics importance: 0.95                      │
│    kids-happy importance: 0.9                           │
│    enjoys-spicy importance: 0.2                         │
│                                                         │
│  "Birthday celebration":                                │
│    easy-logistics importance: 0.3                       │
│    kids-happy importance: 0.5                           │
│    enjoys-spicy importance: 0.8                         │
│                                                         │
│  Same aspects, different weights per context.           │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Aspect importance as attestation:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  CHAIN: keif/aspect:kids-happy → importance_to → keif   │
│    attestation: { by: keif, weight: 0.9 }               │
│                                                         │
│  CHAIN: keif/aspect:kids-happy → importance_in →        │
│         context:weeknight-dinner                        │
│    attestation: { by: keif, weight: 0.95 }              │
│                                                         │
│  CHAIN: keif/aspect:kids-happy → importance_in →        │
│         context:birthday-celebration                    │
│    attestation: { by: keif, weight: 0.5 }               │
│                                                         │
│  It's attestations all the way down.                    │
│  "How much do I care about X in context Y?"             │
│  That's an attestation.                                 │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Finding common ground:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  QUERY: Where do keif and sarah agree?                  │
│                                                         │
│  Find aspects where both attest positively:             │
│                                                         │
│  keif on nandos via kids-happy: +0.8                    │
│  sarah on nandos via kids-happy: +0.7                   │
│  ✓ Agreement on this aspect                             │
│                                                         │
│  keif on nandos via spicy: +1.0                         │
│  sarah on nandos via spicy: -0.3                        │
│  ✗ Disagreement on this aspect                          │
│                                                         │
│  QUERY: What aspects does the group share?              │
│                                                         │
│  pool:friday-gang all attest positively via:            │
│    - budget-friendly                                    │
│    - easy-parking                                       │
│    - accepts-reservations                               │
│                                                         │
│  → These are the group's shared values                  │
│  → Weight options heavily on these                      │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Mood as transient aspect:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  BUBBLE: keif/mood:chip-craving                         │
│    type: mood (transient aspect)                        │
│    created: 2026-01-27T14:00:00Z                        │
│    decay: 24h (mood fades)                              │
│                                                         │
│  { by: keif,                                            │
│    on: nandos,                                          │
│    via: keif/mood:chip-craving,                         │
│    weight: +1.0,                                        │
│    at: 2026-01-27T14:00:00Z }                           │
│                                                         │
│  Tomorrow: mood has decayed                             │
│    effective_weight = weight × decay_factor             │
│                     = 1.0 × 0.2                         │
│                     = 0.2                               │
│                                                         │
│  Moods matter NOW. Values persist.                      │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Aspect taxonomy:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  ASPECT TYPES                                           │
│                                                         │
│  VALUE (persistent, core)                               │
│    keif/value:family-first                              │
│    keif/value:quality-over-quantity                     │
│    → Decay: none, these define you                      │
│                                                         │
│  PREFERENCE (persistent, flexible)                      │
│    keif/preference:spicy-food                           │
│    keif/preference:window-seat                          │
│    → Decay: slow, can change over years                 │
│                                                         │
│  NEED (situational, temporary)                          │
│    keif/need:vegetarian-option (guest is veggie)        │
│    keif/need:wheelchair-accessible (grandma visiting)   │
│    → Decay: event-bound                                 │
│                                                         │
│  MOOD (transient, now)                                  │
│    keif/mood:craving-chips                              │
│    keif/mood:feeling-adventurous                        │
│    → Decay: hours to days                               │
│                                                         │
│  CONSTRAINT (hard, binary)                              │
│    keif/constraint:nut-allergy                          │
│    sarah/constraint:vegetarian                          │
│    → Decay: none, violation = veto                      │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Constraint as special aspect:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  CONSTRAINT: Attestation weight of -1.0 on constraint   │
│              aspect = VETO                              │
│                                                         │
│  sarah/constraint:vegetarian                            │
│                                                         │
│  { by: sarah,                                           │
│    on: the-local-pub,                                   │
│    via: sarah/constraint:vegetarian,                    │
│    weight: -1.0,                                        │
│    because: [pub/menu:no-veggie-mains] }                │
│                                                         │
│  This isn't "I don't like it much."                     │
│  This is "I cannot eat here."                           │
│                                                         │
│  Consensus algorithm: any -1.0 on constraint = remove   │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

The new primitive:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  ATTESTATION (final)                                    │
│                                                         │
│  {                                                      │
│    by: identity,                                        │
│    on: bubble,              // what I'm evaluating      │
│    via: aspect_bubble,      // through what lens        │
│    weight: float [-1, +1],  // how much it satisfies    │
│    at: timestamp,                                       │
│    because: [chain_ids],    // evidence (optional)      │
│    sig: signature                                       │
│  }                                                      │
│                                                         │
│  ASPECT (bubble with type)                              │
│                                                         │
│  {                                                      │
│    id: bubble_id,                                       │
│    type: value|preference|need|mood|constraint,         │
│    owner: identity,         // personal or shared       │
│    domain: string,          // food, logistics, social  │
│    decay: duration|none,    // how fast it fades        │
│    ...                                                  │
│  }                                                      │
│                                                         │
│  BELIEF (computed)                                      │
│                                                         │
│  belief(identity, subject, context, time) =             │
│    aggregate over all attestations by identity on subject│
│    weighted by aspect importance in context             │
│    adjusted by decay at time                            │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

What this enables:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  "Why does Keif prefer Nandos?"                         │
│    → List his aspects with positive weight              │
│    → Spicy, chips, kids love it                         │
│                                                         │
│  "What do Keif and Sarah disagree on?"                  │
│    → Find aspects where weights diverge                 │
│    → Keif: spicy +1.0, Sarah: spicy -0.5                │
│                                                         │
│  "What matters most to this group?"                     │
│    → Find aspects all members attest highly             │
│    → Everyone values: budget, parking, kids-friendly    │
│                                                         │
│  "Why did we choose Wagamama last time?"                │
│    → Look at winning attestations                       │
│    → Best aggregate across shared aspects               │
│                                                         │
│  "What's changed since last year?"                      │
│    → Compare aspect importance over time                │
│    → Kids-friendly went from 0.5 to 0.9 (had a baby)    │
│                                                         │
│  "Recommend something for adventurous mood"             │
│    → Keif has mood:feeling-adventurous active           │
│    → Weight novelty aspects higher                      │
│    → Suggest places not visited before                  │
│                                                         │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

This decomposes "preference" into its constituent thoughts. The WHY is data, not metadata. And it's all still bubbles, chains, attestations.

those weighted beliefs are also surfaced from the history of thoughts and patterns to allow the agent to predict desires, which the human can sign off with attestation they recongise that as true, or false, AND WHY!

│ │ │ PERSONAL ASPECTS (your values) │ │ │ │ keif/aspect:enjoys-spicy │ │ keif/aspect:wants-easy-life │ │ keif/aspect:budget-conscious │ │ │ │ SHARED ASPECTS (pool-level or universal) │ │ │ │ pool:friday-gang/aspect:everyone-can-eat │ │ universal/aspect:kid-friendly │ │ universal/aspect:vegetarian-options │ │

so this is interesting and leads into the symanetic web modelling with https://www.w3.org/OWL/

which lead me to https://allegrograph.com/products/allegrograph/ and https://www.oxfordsemantic.tech/semantic-reasoning-ai

they've always stumbled before 'cause it's slow and hard work to create the data layer

27 Jan

YES. This is the breakthrough. The semantic web died on the data entry problem. You're solving it.

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                                                         │
│  WHY SEMANTIC WEB FAILED                                │
│                                                         │
│  OWL/RDF promise:                                       │
│    - Rich ontologies                                    │
│    - Machine reasoning                                  │
